body_html:
Thank you so much for your comments @F3PiX 🙏

Not sure if I'll find the time tonight, but probably until Thursday I can do some updates 🚢

Very good point with the seeds! I actually forgot about them 🙈 I'll updated.
However, a more general thing about the seeds: I think they are in the conceptually wrong place and should instead go into a db:populate task. I'd update this as a follow up to this already sorta large PR - unless people disagree with this.
Background: seeds at least to me is the minimal data required for the app to actually run. So maybe something like a season because everything else depends on an initial season to be there (just as an example). The seeds are automatically run if one does a db:setup, also on production.
These things ☝️ make it the wrong place for "fake" data for development where one would frequently drop the database or even run the seeds multiple times.
I can get into more details about this, but that's the rough tl;dr reasoning behind this 😉

For restructuring models: I in general agree that it would be a useful things to do. However, I personally think it is sort of pointless if one does not combine it with cleaning up the specs a bit, removing non-used methods and things like that. Therefore an in my opinion better approach is to do something like

clean up one model at a time (including tests)

Not sure if ☝️ is good fit for newcomes to the codebase though 🤔

Thank you so much for your comments @F3PiX 🙏 

Not sure if I'll find the time tonight, but probably until Thursday I can do some updates 🚢 

Very good point with the seeds! I actually forgot about them 🙈 I'll updated.
However, a more general thing about *the seeds*: I think they are in the conceptually wrong place and should instead go into a `db:populate` task. I'd update this as a follow up to this already sorta large PR - unless people disagree with this.
Background: `seeds` at least to me is the minimal data required for the app to actually run. So maybe something like a `season` because everything else depends on an initial season to be there (just as an example). The seeds are automatically run if one does a `db:setup`, also on production.
These things ☝️ make it the wrong place for "fake" data for development where one would frequently drop the database or even run the seeds multiple times.
I can get into more details about this, but that's the rough tl;dr reasoning behind this 😉 

For restructuring models: I in general agree that it would be a useful things to do. **However**, I personally think it is sort of pointless if one does not combine it with cleaning up the specs a bit, removing non-used methods and things like that. Therefore an in my opinion better approach is to do something like
> clean up one model at a time (including tests)

Not sure if ☝️ is good fit for newcomes to the codebase though 🤔
